title: Poppy needs to keep either her passive or her ult, otherwise, she's not Poppy.
body:
I don't main Poppy, but I do really like her, and as someone who used to main Veigar, I'm here to tell you that Poppy's about to get Veigar'd.

I've just become aware that back in March, Meddler basically said that the upcoming Poppy rework would remove her passive and her ult, and only keep her E. [Link](http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/03/red-post-collection-poppy-and-gangplank.html), also, Solcrushed, who's working on her rework, if I'm not mistaken, has apparently said that her E is the most iconic part of her kit. [Link, scroll down a bit.](http://www.newsoflegends.com/index.php/tag/poppy/#4) I don't agree with this at all, and I'm pretty sure most Poppy players don't either.

The most iconic parts of her kit are the parts that allow her to charge into the enemy team like the Juggernaut and get away with it, aka; her passive and her ult. It's her survivability that makes her iconic not the "charge-in" part. While everyone else on the team is busy playing long range League of Dodgeball, Poppy just says "fuck it, I'm going in" and if the Poppy player is good, they succeed. If they aren't good, or if they miscalculated, they get destroyed, just like anyone else who makes an ill-advised engage, and if you don't agree with this answer one question. If Poppy truly is unstoppable and always succeeds when diving, why isn't she on every team, why isn't she a perma-ban?

Here's the thing. Poppy is a very unpopular pick right now (and as far as I know, she pretty much always has been) and the reason for that is because there really isn't anything she does well enough to be picked for any other reason other than the way she "feels." She gets countered hard in lane very easily, possibly worse than any other champion. It's amazingly easy to deny her farm. Poppy is always going to have a difficult time surviving and farming early game. Her mana costs are so abysmal that she also has to make sure she picks her fights correctly too or she'll be left with no oomph and no ability to threaten her lane opponent. Some may argue that she's a virtually unstoppable high reward champion in late game, which is true, if the liability of being Poppy doesn't backfire to the point where she never reaches lategame which it often does. My point being, she may be high reward, but she is also deceptively high risk as well. It's a fair tradeoff.

Poppy right now has a unique feel among all 124 of the champions in League of Legends, she is literally the only champion who does what she does and feels the way she feels. If Riot simply turns her into a tank, as they seem to be indicating, then why would I pick Poppy over the 10 to 20 other champions who also fill that role? Obviously, based on the fact that she's 121st most picked out of 124 options "Why would I pick Poppy?" Is a question most League of Legends players are already asking. But I think I know the answer, at least for those of us who do pick her.

**Why do we pick Poppy?**

To me the "feeling" of Poppy is unique there are several aspects and attributes about Poppy that make her different from the other 123 champions in the game. 

**~ Revenge:** Poppy spends most of the laning phase in most games getting destroyed. Denied farm at best, killed over and over at worst. (I can't speak to jungle Poppy, never really messed with that.) Her passive is literally the only thing that makes her laning phase possible. She can sit there at 10% health and the Poppy player can make a calculated risk to go in and Q the cannon minion, because they know they still have a chance to get that sweet, sweet 40 gold, and if they're lucky get out alive. The point I'm making though is that in most cases Poppy spends 10 to 15 minutes every game getting abused relentlessly and having a terrible time (unless the Poppy player is super skilled or their opponent is very unskilled, or your jungler camps top lane.) 

Then, it happens. Poppy finally gets enough ranks in her Q, or gets her first full item (for me it's usually Triforce) and then it's like she just explodes. Poppy's finally done with your shit and now it's payback time. She's like George McFly knocking out Biff in Back to the Future. The kid who spent the whole game getting picked on, and now she's a certified badass and the other team needs to look out because it's time for some hammer diplomacy. As a Poppy player the moment when you get that shut-down on the top laner who's been harassing you the whole game is one of the best feels you can ever have playing League of Legends. Although the double and triple kills she gets in the ensuing teamfights because the enemy team has no idea that they need to be afraid of her are great feels too.

**~Determination:** This one really fits with her story and theme as well, just like Poppy in her story never gave up in the presence of crushing adversity, Poppy players know that if they hang in there long enough, and somehow make it to late game, anything is possible. Poppy is like the 2004 Red Sox, they haven't won in 86 years and they're down 0-3 to the Yankees in the pennant, but somehow determined enough to reverse-sweep and pull out the 4-3 win, then sweep the World Series. Again, a lot of this is due to her passive, but the decision making surrounding it is something that's actually present the whole game. Poppy constantly has to make decisions revolving around weather her passive will allow her to get what she's after, whether it's farm, or a surprise kill on the lane opponent. But this isn't without tons of risk. I don't know how many times I've dived my lane opponent as Poppy, stayed for the fight cause I knew if my Q came up again I'd get the kill despite the damage they're putting on to me, got the kill and then died to creeps because of course I had to fight them in their creep wave and those caster minion bolts aren't mitigated by my passive. Point is, I'm not very skilled, a good Poppy player knows when and more importantly _how_ to never give up, and when that works, it just feels like such a Poppy thing to do. Poppy's ult contributes to this too. She's one of the few champions who can legitimately take a deep breath, and then hit the tower-dive button, and exhale if/when she gets out alive. It's always a tense moment and not as much of a "free win" as her opponents seem to think it is. Especially because good opponents should be able to anticipate and even bait it. Also I really feel that in the current state of "get baron and poke the tower down from long range" that seems to be the only way to take base turrets nowadays, having at least one champion who just goes in isn't unhealthy at all, especially if it's accompanied by the appropriate amount of risk.

**~The Yolo Factor:** To be fair, every champion has this. The button they press when they just want to start some shit. But most of them die when they do it, or they bank on their insane burst damage preventing them getting killed in return (Kat, Zed, Riven.) But Poppy's version is a little bit different, Poppy is uniquely able to get away with "just engaging" without having to fear getting bursted instantly like assassins do because of her ult and passive. Now I understand that typically this type of engage is reserved for assassins, and I understand that Poppy is sort of played like an assassin and that doesn't fit her. She shouldn't be an assassin, I agree with that, I think she should do a bit more sustained damage over time, because defensively she's strong enough to "just engage" and stay in the fight without relying on burst like she does now. I do think she needs a rework, but I also think she needs to keep her ability to engage and stay safe, but maybe lose a bit of her ability to assassinate as compensation. If she did a little less damage (or had to "spend" more to do the same damage [in the form of say, cooldowns because lord knows her mana costs are already insane]) but had the same capacity to survive, this is what she needs to keep her feel. My main point being, Poppy's identity is tied to her ability to **engage and survive**, not in _the specific way_ she engages. Her E is a great part of her identity, her R is a better one. Right now all of her power budget is in her Q, and sort of her R, her W doesn't do anything (except keep her semi-relevant in league of mobility) and her E is only situationally useful. Poppy can survive without her ult, she could maybe survive without her passive (though I'm not too big on that prospect) but if she loses both, she's lost everything that makes her unique. (In fact I could even envision a world where Poppy's ult _becomes_ her passive, but then I'd worry it would basically make her too similar to Alistar, especially since her E and his headbutt are virtually the same already and if this change were made their ults would be virtually the same too.) A successful Poppy rework will move her damage around (possibly nerf it a bit) and not just front-load all of it on her Q, fix her mana problems and make her laning a bit more tolerable, and keep her more or less just as safe when yoloing into the enemy team or turrets. This is a key part of her identity that's being thrown out the window I'm afraid. Now the obvious thing to say here is "well what if the rework does all this, but without her current passive and her current ult?" Well, if it did that'd be great, but I kind of don't know how it would without replacing them with abilities that are equally "unhealthy." Effectively the "problem" with Poppy now is that late game or super-fed Poppy can yolo, and get at least one guaranteed kill without fear of retribution. I feel like a slight nerf to her damage and/or her ult timer would fix this, without doing away with her ability to yolo-dive, or changing what her abilities do. (Too much of a nerf to her damage though would discourage diving and therefore make her "just another tank" so it's a fine line that's difficult to balance and still maintain her identity, but identity is the only think keeping her even remotely relevant right now.)

Finally, we play Poppy because:

**~She's The Underdog:** Big things come in small packages, and everyone loves the underdog. Anyone who's ever lost to Poppy, or ever won with her understands this completely. People argue Poppy's passive is bad because it has clarity issues aka; "as Poppy's opponent, I don't know if I can kill her based on her current health." It's easy to make the argument that this is "unhealthy" for the game, but I'd argue it's actually essential to Poppy's feel. And Poppy is not the only champion with deception built into her kit, other champions can be deceptive, Shaco and LeBlanc are the most blatant examples, but even some tanks like Volibear with his passive have similar deceptive qualities. Her passive is deceiving, yes, but this isn't a problem thematically, in fact it's no different from the way her size and appearance belie her true power (this is also why Lollipoppy is the best skin in the game, but I digress.) Poppy is the underdog from start to finish. 121st most popular pick out of 124 options, spends the early part of most games losing, has the worst mana management of anyone, but through determination, cunning, and a little bit of deception, she hides her true power until it's too late for her enemies to do anything about it. Poppy is a true hero, and League of Legends needs this kind of hero, the unpopular kind, the one who takes abuse but never quits, the kind that doesn't attract many followers, but who, nevertheless stands victorious in the end because the player who chose her believed, persevered, and crushed her naysayers under the surprising might of her hammer. 

If Poppy loses her ult and her passive, what will she be? Just another tank who soaks damage and delays the enemy team until her team can show up and get the kills? Just another wet noodle fight in top lane until there's a teamfight at Dragon? League of Legends has tons of those. But it only has one blue-skinned, hammer-weilding, badass yordle who will fuck your shit up if you let your guard down even a tiny bit. After the rework, this needs to stay true, anything else is unacceptable.

replies.body: There is absolutely no way to salvage either of those 2 parts of her kit and have Poppy good with a rework. Simply because those 2 parts are hilariously broken, and overpowered.

Her ult was intended for her to duel someone, right? I think that part can be preserved in a way that still has the "yolo" factor.

What if it was changed so that when you ulted a champion as Poppy, that champion could only attack you and you could only attack them, and everything else from both teams was ignored? You ult their ADC and now their ADC can't attack the tower, they have to fight you for the durration of your ult. They can choose where they move and what spells to use, so it's not a "taunt" per say, but it achieves a similar effect. Similarly, Poppy can't ult the support and go and attack the ADC, since she'd do zero damage.

I don't dobut that the numbers would have to change, but I think this change would still keep the feel of her current ult.
That would make her a ripoff of DOTA2's siege commander.
I've never played or watched Dota 2, so I'm guessing the idea's not that hard to come up with.
I think I suggested this years ago and it got downvoted into oblivion.

Another way I thought of to keep the same feel of her ult, without being super broken. Basically Poppy takes heavily reduced damage from everyone else, and gains CC reduction from all others. You still get the feel of isolating a target and screwing them over, but this allows the enemy team to actually play against it.
It could need a  duration buff then.
At 6 seconds it's even longer than {{champion:23}}'s ult. And we all know how long that ult lasts.
Yea, its pretty long, thank god he's not cc immune while inside of it.

Her passive is just as broken as {{champion:238}}s. You make it sound like she's the most over powered champion in game when I've seen her in Free Week and yet the apparent supposed champion {{champion:83}} is too powerful. This game has champions that heal with every other spell, deal bonus damage, and gain lots of movement speed bonus. You think that one champion having a damage counter to the serious damage a ADC or burst mage can do is wrong?

Even if they change/gut/remove Poppy's current ult and passive, that doesn't mean being a highly durable in-your-face fighter is off the table. 

I'm kind of looking forward to a Poppy that's a rough tough shield-bashing bruiser. To me, that's the character's identity. She's a blacksmith, a weapon and armor forger, with a giant hammer heavy armor and a sturdy shield. She's an assertive takes-no-shit frontline fighter who beats people across the head with shield and hammer until they collapse from a concussion or a broken skull. Even though she is fun in her current state, to me a lategame hypercarry assassin is something that would fit better on a more nimble/lithe character concept. Poppy is stocky strong and stubborn as hell. She screams "Tank", and I can't wait for the rework to go live.

They need to keep the *feel* of her ult and passive in her kit, but keeping either of those incredibly ancient, outdated mechanics in her kit whole cloth would completely spoil anything new they tried to put in.

Instead of keeping the actual abilities themselves, they need to keep them in spirit/effect. She needs to:

* Get tankier when at low health (the method used in her current passive is so archaic it hurts, but the premise isn't totally unredeemable)
* Be able to YOLO dive a whole team somehow (I have no clue how to fix her current ult and keep this, but I sincerely hope they don't neuter her raid-boss potential)
* Be a strong mid-late game duelist (the durability+1v1 damage amp is amazing)
* Be a powerful siege breaker (ult someone, ignore tower for several seconds)
* Still turn into a golden deathball somehow.

I mean Jax level for late game dueling, but a stronger version (like she is now). As it stands, she can out duel a late game Nasus or Jax, and she needs to keep that dominance.

Giving her a hybrid form of Olaf's and Alistar's ults could work as a replacement, meaning she is un-CC-able except by her target, and takes drastically reduced damage from everyone except her target, rather than total damage immunity.

Poppy remake is going to be garbage for sure. Poppy was my favourite champ at one point but I know Riot's rework will just screw her up. Basically removing Poppy from the game and replacing her with a different champ called 'Poppy'.

RIP Poppy.
FU rito.
You do realize that this is Riot's game and they can do whatever they want to it. I know that Olafing her would be bad but you don't have really any right over what they do to her.

Yes, Riot can do whatever they want. But if they care about their jobs what they _SHOULD_ want is to make changes that their customers like and agree with. That's the definition of good business practices.

Threads like this exist not because "we're entitled to tell them how to do their jobs" but rather, as their customers we're trying to provide feedback about what we want, so that they can then do their jobs better. Riot is one of the only companies on the planet that I know of who even pretends like they care about this, and that's why it's worth the effort to communicate these things to them. At least in theory.

Recently though, it seems Riot doesn't so much care about what their customers think about changes to certain champions, and that's bad business IMO. If they establish a pattern of ignoring feedback, it will come back to bite them eventually.

saying her passive is iconic is like saying high damage is iconic to Zed. Yes, Zed's associated with high damage, but it really isn't what makes you think "That's definitely Zed!", since there are tons of champions with high damage, just like there are tons of champions who are tanky besides poppy. They can very easily remove her passive and find out another way to make her tanky without being as obnoxious as it is currently. They say her E is the most iconic part of her kit because, other than that absurdly unbalanced ultimate, which honestly shouldn't exist as is in the game, her kit is: generic hit-modifier damage boost Q, stat/movespeed buff W, passive tankyness from her innate passive (well, that sounded weird, but I think you understood what I meant). Her E is the only really interesting and truly "different" thing about her skills. Being tanky is part of her identity, yes, but simply "well, she receives low damage from stuff" really isn't iconic.

This kinda makes me think you don't really play as Poppy very much.

The reason it's iconic isn't because as her opponent "oh look Poppy takes less damage." It's because as Poppy you're like "I have 10% HP....I think I can still kill them if they get within range of a wall, then I can finally farm minions!" It's because of all the times someone overextends and dives you when you're low and you survive with like 10 HP because your passive is awesome. That's why it's iconic. As someone facing against Poppy it might just be annoying, but as the Poppy player, you're constantly aware of your passive and hopefully factoring it into your decision making. I guess it's really only a thing that Poppy players understand.

not really. It's just passive tankyness - on an overtuned way. You also don't dive an irelia or a singed or a ton of other champions, it's really not iconic. At most you could argue that in her case, her tankyness is SO overtuned (in the form of her passive + resist bonus on W + ult) that the extremety of her tankyness stands out, but is that really "iconic"? Release Zyra had overtuned damage, but was huge damage ever part of her identity?

I'll quote you, changing a small thing: "As someone facing against LeBlanc it might just be annoying, but as the LeBlanc player, you're constantly aware of your burst and hopefully factoring it into your decision making. I guess it's really only a thing that LeBlanc players understand."
Yes, LeBlanc is associated with retarded burst, but that doesn't mean that she can't have her damage nerfed (as it has been more than once), and yes it is something you constantly have to keep in mind, playing as OR against a LB, but it's only a part of her identity - it isn't her core iconic thing. That'd be a mix of her replicating ultimate and her "trickster" mobility with W, IMHO. 

Removing poppy's passive and adding a more interactive, less obnoxious kind of tankyness with whatever else skill won't ruin her "hard to dive" identity, because that's really not an identity.

What's iconic to Poppy is her ability to be trash early game and farm up, and ending the game carrying the entire team while building pure dmg. Her ult and passive allow her to actually tank up lategame and become a threat. She has really obvious counterplay that people ignore when they talk about how her passive/ult are op, and her entire character. Her passive just simply gives her lots of tankiness when low, allowing her to take your initial burst and continue as the rest of your attacks don't do much. Her ult is something you counter by simply disengaging, which is stupid, but is only good on very hard engages lategame where Poppy has the dmg to back up her invulnerability.

poppy's passive is poppy.
Thats all I think of when I think poppy.
Her Q and her Passive.

Idc about her ult since its so kitable and its just mostly good against idiots or in situations where you somehow are allowed to dive a turret/team and get a kill it becomes an ult.

There are some poppy mains from s2/s1 i remember that didnt get ult until level 8/9 because they wanted to max Q first or W first just to live in lane longer or kill someone with Q ignite because ult mana cost wasn't worth it to give up another Q.

Poppy cannot keep her ult. Period. That ult is the primary reason she's in the "nerfed until rework" category. Pressing one button and getting to **completely and totally ignore** 4 players of the enemy team for 6-8 seconds, PLUS getting 20-40% bonus damage against that fifth player is not *just* broken, it's uncounterable. There is absolutely no counterplay to that ability itself, and the ability gives Poppy as a whole nearly zero counterplay for her whole character for a long ass duration. The rest of her kit is powerful enough that keeping that ult just isn't going to happen. She's got too much damage (and Triforce synergy) packed into that kit for the long duration near-complete invulnerability to stick around.

It would even be cool if you could at least cc her from outside her ult but damn girl... nothing? I can't help my boy out and he's right next to me. "Somebody get this bitch off me!" We could only watch as he died. I told his wife it was a good death. We buried him near the wolf camp if you want to pay your re- Oh god here she comes again! ULT'S UP! ULT'S UP!

Poppy has plenty of counterplay. Melee only with no real mobility, severely weak early game, and cripplingly high mana costs. If poppy got to late game, it's because your team did nothing to stop her. That's your fault.

She's the only hypercarry left in the game. And her ult is pretty standard as far as hypercarry abilities go - they tend to be low on the counterplay front, as necessary, cause otherwise there'd be no point to the champ.

Examples of hypercarry abilities include:
A large aoe stun around yourself for 6 seconds
Multiplying your damage by 4x
Making a copy of yourself to attack everyone on the map simultaneously, while you can teleport to any copy, and they benefit from your 30% damage reflection passive.

Compared to those, Poppy's ult seems about right.

>If poppy got to late game, it's because your team did nothing to stop her. That's your fault.

Poppy being strong late game isn't the problem. Poppy being literally unstoppable in a good number of scenarios is the problem. It's ok for a champion to be strong late and weak early, but they should not have a period in the game where there is literally nothing you can do to oppose them. If there is a member on my team too weak to stop Poppy, the entire team can't stop Poppy. That's a much worse problem than any of the Dota abilities you cite.

>A large aoe stun around yourself for 6 seconds

Who, Naga? That's not a stun, it's a stasis. Big, very important difference. Besides, you can actually counter this. Magic immunity will give you all the room in the world to stun the Naga before she teleports out to rat another day, and there are ways to stop her split pushing.

>Multiplying your damage by 4x

And yet, Sven falls off in the late game because he's so reliant on the long early BKB charges to get work done midgame. Even with the BKB, he isn't going to do shit against a bane ult or an angry beastmaster. He's got plenty of counterplay. High damage, easy counterplay.

Those exist in a game where these sorts of abilities are commonplace, and where there are other strong abilities that can screw their abilities. Poppy isn't part of Dota. If she were, there might still be a problem with the design of her ultimate (you'll note that any very strong defensive ability has some counter in Dota, as opposed to Poppy's which just oftentimes doesn't).

Huh, but i thought you could build counters to poppy's ult too.

I know spirit visage _will_ block it, and I thought mercurial scimitar will also remove the effect from you. Not to mention the obvious counters available to everyone like Zhonya's and flash.

You are right though in that there aren't any champion abilities that can counter poppy's ult, but maybe that's the problem - ultimate's just really aren't ultimate for most champions.

It wouldn't hurt my feelings much of Poppy got a totally new Ult, but the two things really define her, IMO, is her ability to take nukes to the face like a boss and her wall-slam ability.

Poppy's passive makes her tanky in a way that no other champion is.  She is able to wade through heavy attacks, but smaller faster dot-y-er attacks still eat her alive.  It's a lot more interesting than just giving her passive resist (like Shy) or a refreshing shield (like Vi).  No one else eats fireballs with their face the way Poppy does.

Would this still be a problem if her ult didn't last as long?

Would it still be a problem if she did less damage overall, or if the damage amp on her ult were removed?

Conversely, why couldn't they remove her ult, but keep her passive? Then if she dived you, she'd still be killable/CCable (and targetable by turrets,) but it would give her the help she needs in laning phase, and possibly score dividends against opponents that didn't understand it, or reward keen Poppy players who did, like what happens now. What makes the ult OP is that she can do damage to your team while your team can't do anything to her (if she ults the support like she should).  If the ults time is shortened and she is unable to do damage during that time, the ult will just feel weak and useless.  If her damage is nerfed somehow so she can't do damage during that time, then again the ult will feel weak and useless.  The only way her ult is useful right now is if it allows her to do something nobody should be allowed to do in league.

Also, the main problem with her passive is that it provides inconsistent results.  Champions like Lucian, Cassiopeia, and Karthus (who deal smaller amounts of damage very quickly to get high dps) have a huge advantage because they can deal full damage for longer before the 50% reduction kicks in.  Other champions like Graves or Annie are going to reach that 10% current health more easily are going to be at a disadvantage.  It is not even a matter of if the champion is a burst champion or sustained damage.  Lucian is very bursty, but because he shoots so many auto attacks between his spells, he deals smaller amounts of damage more frequently.

It would be possible to make a passive that works in a similar way (reduced damage at lower health) without being random or inconsistent.  And I think that would probably be fine.
